contentList.content: Arcane Archer
Arcane Archers study a unique elven method of archery that weaves magic into attacks to produce supernatural effects.
Arcane Archer Lore
You learn magical theory or some of the secrets of nature – typical for practitioners of of this elven martial tradition. You choose to learn either the Prestidigitation or Druidcraft cantrip.
You learn magical theory or some of the secrets of nature – typical for practitioners of of this elven martial tradition. You to gain proficiency in the Arcana and Nature skills.
Arcane Shots
Gain an Arcane Shot option of your choice. They are all magical effects, and each one is associated with one of the schools of magic.
Arcane Shot Charges

You can unleash special magical effects with some of your shots. Once per turn when you fire an arrow from a shortbow or longbow as part of the Attack action, you can apply one of your Arcane Shot options to that arrow. You decide to use the option when the arrow hits, unless the option doesn’t involve an attack roll. You have two uses of this ability, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a short or long rest.
Arcane Shots
You can unleash special magical effects with some of your shots.
Arcane Shot Charges

You can unleash special magical effects with some of your shots. Once per turn when you fire an arrow from a shortbow or longbow as part of the Attack action, you can apply one of your Arcane Shot options to that arrow. You decide to use the option when the arrow hits, unless the option doesn’t involve an attack roll. You have two uses of this ability, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a short or long rest.
Banishing Arrow
You use abjuration magic to try to temporarily banish your target to a harmless location in the Feywild.

The creature hit by the arrow must also succeed on a Charisma <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or be <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BANISHED">Banished</LSTag>. At the end of its next turn, the target reappears in the space it vacated or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.
Beguiling Arrow
Beguiling Arrow Target
Beguiling Arrow Choose Ally
Beguiling Arrow Ally
Beguiling Arrow Followup
Beguiling Arrow Ally Link
Your enchantment magic causes this arrow to temporarily beguile its target.

The creature hit by the arrow takes an additional [1] psychic damage, and choose one of your allies within [2] of the target. The target must succeed on a Wisdom <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, or it is <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED">Charmed</LSTag> by the chosen ally until the start of your next turn.
⚠ This effect ends early if the chosen ally attacks the charmed target, deals damage to it, or forces it to make a <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>. ⚠
Choose an ally within [1] of the target of your Beguiling Arrow. The creature will be <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED">Charmed</LSTag> by the chosen ally until the start of your next turn.

On a failed Wisdom <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, this creature will be <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED">Charmed</LSTag> by your chosen ally until the start of your next turn.

On a failed Wisdom <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, the target of your Beguiling Arrow will be <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED">Charmed</LSTag> by this ally until the start of your next turn.
Attempt to have the target become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED">Charmed</LSTag> by your chosen ally until the start of your next turn.
Link to the Arcane Archer's Beguiling Arrow <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED">Charmed</LSTag> condition.
Bursting Arrow
You imbue your arrow with force energy drawn from the school of evocation.
The arrow detonates after your attack. Immediately after the arrow hits the creature, the target and all other creatures within [1] take an additional [2] Force Damage.
Enfeebling Arrow
You weave necromantic magic into your arrow.

The creature hit by the arrow takes an extra [1] necrotic damage. The target must also succeed on a Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, or the damage dealt by its weapon attacks is halved until the start of your next turn.
Grasping Arrow
Grasped
When this arrow strikes its target, conjuration magic creates grasping, poisonous brambles, which wrap around the target.

The creature hit by the arrow takes an extra [1] poisom damage, has its speed is reduced by [2], and it takes [1] slashing damage the first time on each turn it moves without teleporting. The brambles can be removed if the target makes a successful Strength <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or if an ally uses the Help action.
The affected creature's speed is reduced by [1], and it takes slashing damage the first time on each turn it moves without teleporting.
Piercing Arrow
You use transmutation magic to give your arrow an ethereal quality.

The arrow fires forward in a [1] long line before disappearing. Each creature in that line must make a Dexterity <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or take damage as if it were hit by the arrow, plus an extra [2] piercing damage.
Seeking Arrow
Using divination magic, you grant your arrow the ability to seek out your target, allowing the arrow to curve and twist its path in search of its prey.

If the target is within the weapon’s range and there is a path large enough for the arrow to travel to the target, the target must make a Dexterity <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>. On a failed <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, it takes damage as if it were hit by the arrow, plus an extra [1] force damage.

If the target fails its <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> against your arrow, it sheds dim light and cannot turn <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBLE">Invisible</LSTag> until the start of your next turn.
Location Known
The affected creature's location is known to the Arcane Archer. It sheds dim light and cannot turn <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBLE">Invisible</LSTag> for 1 turn.
Shadow Arrow
You weave illusion magic into your arrow, causing it to occlude your foe’s vision with shadows.

The creature hit by the arrow takes an additional [1] psychic damage, and must succeed on a Wisdom <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or be unable to see anything farther than [2] away until the start of your next turn.
Curving Shot
Whenever you miss with a magic arrow , you can use a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">Bonus Action</LSTag> to reroll that attack against a different target within [1].
You may reroll your attack roll against a different target within [1].
Cannot be targeted by Curving Shot
Can be targeted by Curving Shot

When you make an attack roll with a magic arrow and miss, you can use a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">Bonus Action</LSTag> to reroll the attack roll against a different target within 60 feet of the original target.
Arcane Shot Cooldown
Once per turn when you fire an arrow from a shortbow or longbow as part of the Attack action, you can apply one of your Arcane Shot options to that arrow.
Break Free
Attempt to remove the Grasping Arrow's brambles with a successful Strength <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>.
Magic Arrow

You gain the ability to infuse arrows with magic. Whenever you fire a nonmagical arrow from a shortbow or longbow, you can make it magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.
Magic Arrow Infusion
Arrows fired from this weapon overcome resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.
Ever-Ready Shot
Your magical archery is available whenever battle starts. If you roll initiative and have no uses of Arcane Shot remaining, you regain one use of it.
